145 0x0090, 0x0091, 0x0092, 0x0093, 0x0094, 0x0095, 0x0096, 0x0097, 0x0098, 0x0099, 0x009A, 0x009B, 0x009C, 0x009D, 0x009E, 0x009F,
146 0x00A0, 0x1E02, 0x1E03, 0x00A3, 0x010A, 0x010B, 0x1E0A, 0x00A7, 0x1E80, 0x00A9, 0x1E82, 0x1E0B, 0x1EF2, 0x00AD, 0x00AE, 0x0178,
147 0x1E1E, 0x1E1F, 0x0120, 0x0121, 0x1E40, 0x1E41, 0x00B6, 0x1E56, 0x1E81, 0x1E57, 0x1E83, 0x1E60, 0x1EF3, 0x1E84, 0x1E85, 0x1E61,
148 0x00C0, 0x00C1, 0x00C2, 0x00C3, 0x00C4, 0x00C5, 0x00C6, 0x00C7, 0x00C8, 0x00C9, 0x00CA, 0x00CB, 0x00CC, 0x00CD, 0x00CE, 0x00CF,

195 0x0452, 0x2018, 0x2019, 0x201C, 0x201D, 0x2022, 0x2013, 0x2014, 0xFFFD, 0x2122, 0x0459, 0x203A, 0x045A, 0x045C, 0x045B, 0x045F,
196 0x00A0, 0x040E, 0x045E, 0x0408, 0x00A4, 0x0490, 0x00A6, 0x00A7, 0x0401, 0x00A9, 0x0404, 0x00AB, 0x00AC, 0x00AD, 0x00AE, 0x0407,

198 0x0410, 0x0411, 0x0412, 0x0413, 0x0414, 0x0415, 0x0416, 0x0417, 0x0418, 0x0419, 0x041A, 0x041B, 0x041C, 0x041D, 0x041E, 0x041F,

223
224
225} // Codecs
226
227
228void
229TextDecoder::Append(std::wstring& str, const uint8_t* bytes, size_t length, CharacterSet charset)
230{
231 switch (charset)
232 {
233 case CharacterSet::Unknown:
234 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_1:
235 case CharacterSet::ASCII:
236 {
237 str.append(bytes, bytes + length);
238 break;
239 }
240 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_2:
241 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_3:
242 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_4:
243 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_5:
244 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_6:
245 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_7:
246 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_8:
247 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_9:
248 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_10:
249 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_11:
250 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_13:
251 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_14:
252 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_15:
253 case CharacterSet::ISO8859_16:
254 case CharacterSet::Cp437:
255 case CharacterSet::Cp1250:
256 case CharacterSet::Cp1251:
257 case CharacterSet::Cp1252:
258 case CharacterSet::Cp1256:
259 {
260 str.reserve(str.length() + length);
261 for (size_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
262 uint8_t c = bytes[i];
263 if (c < 128)
264 str.push_back(c);
265 else
266 str.push_back(Codecs::SINGLE_BYTE_CODEPAGES[((int)charset - (int)CharacterSet::ISO8859_2) * 128 + c - 128]);
267 }
268 break;
269 }
270 case CharacterSet::Shift_JIS:
271 {
272 std::vector<uint16_t> buf;
273 JPTextDecoder::AppendShiftJIS(buf, bytes, length);
274 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf16(str, buf.data(), buf.size());
275 break;
276 }
277 case CharacterSet::Big5:
278 {
279 std::vector<uint16_t> buf;
280 Big5TextDecoder::AppendBig5(buf, bytes, length);
281 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf16(str, buf.data(), buf.size());
282 break;
283 }
284 case CharacterSet::GB2312:
285 {
286 std::vector<uint16_t> buf;
287 GBTextDecoder::AppendGB2312(buf, bytes, length);
288 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf16(str, buf.data(), buf.size());
289 break;
290 }
291 case CharacterSet::GB18030:
292 {
293 std::vector<uint16_t> buf;
294 GBTextDecoder::AppendGB18030(buf, bytes, length);
295 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf16(str, buf.data(), buf.size());
296 break;
297 }
298 case CharacterSet::EUC_JP:
299 {
300 std::vector<uint16_t> buf;
301 JPTextDecoder::AppendEUCJP(buf, bytes, length);
302 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf16(str, buf.data(), buf.size());
303 break;
304 }
305 case CharacterSet::EUC_KR:
306 {
307 std::vector<uint16_t> buf;
308 KRTextDecoder::AppendEucKr(buf, bytes, length);
309 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf16(str, buf.data(), buf.size());
310 break;
311 break;
312 }
313 case CharacterSet::UnicodeBig:
314 {
315 str.reserve(str.length() + length / 2);
316 for (size_t i = 0; i + 1 < length; i += 2) {
317 str.push_back((static_cast<wchar_t>(bytes[i]) << 8) + bytes[i + 1]);
318 }
319 break;
320 }
321 case CharacterSet::UTF8:
322 {
323 TextUtfEncoding::AppendUtf8(str, bytes, length);
324 break;
325 }
326 default:
327 break;
328 }
329}
330
331/**
332* @param bytes bytes encoding a string, whose encoding should be guessed
333* @param hints decode hints if applicable
334* @return name of guessed encoding; at the moment will only guess one of:
335* {@link #SHIFT_JIS}, {@link #UTF8}, {@link #ISO88591}, or the platform
336* default encoding if none of these can possibly be correct
337*/
338CharacterSet
339TextDecoder::GuessEncoding(const uint8_t* bytes, size_t length, CharacterSet fallback)
340{
341 // For now, merely tries to distinguish ISO-8859-1, UTF-8 and Shift_JIS,
342 // which should be by far the most common encodings.
343 bool canBeISO88591 = true;
344 bool canBeShiftJIS = true;
345 bool canBeUTF8 = true;
346 int utf8BytesLeft = 0;
347 //int utf8LowChars = 0;
348 int utf2BytesChars = 0;
349 int utf3BytesChars = 0;
350 int utf4BytesChars = 0;
351 int sjisBytesLeft = 0;
352 //int sjisLowChars = 0;
353 int sjisKatakanaChars = 0;
354 //int sjisDoubleBytesChars = 0;
355 int sjisCurKatakanaWordLength = 0;
356 int sjisCurDoubleBytesWordLength = 0;
357 int sjisMaxKatakanaWordLength = 0;
358 int sjisMaxDoubleBytesWordLength = 0;
359 //int isoLowChars = 0;
360 //int isoHighChars = 0;
361 int isoHighOther = 0;
362
363 bool utf8bom = length > 3 && bytes[0] == 0xEF && bytes[1] == 0xBB && bytes[2] == 0xBF;
364
365 for (size_t i = 0; i < length && (canBeISO88591 || canBeShiftJIS || canBeUTF8); ++i)
366 {
367 int value = bytes[i];
368
369 // UTF-8 stuff
370 if (canBeUTF8) {
371 if (utf8BytesLeft > 0) {
372 if ((value & 0x80) == 0) {
373 canBeUTF8 = false;
374 }
375 else {
376 utf8BytesLeft--;
377 }
378 }
379 else if ((value & 0x80) != 0) {
380 if ((value & 0x40) == 0) {
381 canBeUTF8 = false;
382 }
383 else {
384 utf8BytesLeft++;
385 if ((value & 0x20) == 0) {
386 utf2BytesChars++;
387 }
388 else {
389 utf8BytesLeft++;
390 if ((value & 0x10) == 0) {
391 utf3BytesChars++;
392 }
393 else {
394 utf8BytesLeft++;
395 if ((value & 0x08) == 0) {
396 utf4BytesChars++;
397 }
398 else {
399 canBeUTF8 = false;
400 }
401 }
402 }
403 }
404 } //else {
405 //utf8LowChars++;
406 //}
407 }
408
409 // ISO-8859-1 stuff
410 if (canBeISO88591) {
411 if (value > 0x7F && value < 0xA0) {
412 canBeISO88591 = false;
413 }
414 else if (value > 0x9F) {
415 if (value < 0xC0 || value == 0xD7 || value == 0xF7) {
416 isoHighOther++;
417 } //else {
418 //isoHighChars++;
419 //}
420 } //else {
421 //isoLowChars++;
422 //}
423 }
424
425 // Shift_JIS stuff
426 if (canBeShiftJIS) {
427 if (sjisBytesLeft > 0) {
428 if (value < 0x40 || value == 0x7F || value > 0xFC) {
429 canBeShiftJIS = false;
430 }
431 else {
432 sjisBytesLeft--;
433 }
434 }
435 else if (value == 0x80 || value == 0xA0 || value > 0xEF) {
436 canBeShiftJIS = false;
437 }
438 else if (value > 0xA0 && value < 0xE0) {
439 sjisKatakanaChars++;
440 sjisCurDoubleBytesWordLength = 0;
441 sjisCurKatakanaWordLength++;
442 if (sjisCurKatakanaWordLength > sjisMaxKatakanaWordLength) {
443 sjisMaxKatakanaWordLength = sjisCurKatakanaWordLength;
444 }
445 }
446 else if (value > 0x7F) {
447 sjisBytesLeft++;
448 //sjisDoubleBytesChars++;
449 sjisCurKatakanaWordLength = 0;
450 sjisCurDoubleBytesWordLength++;
451 if (sjisCurDoubleBytesWordLength > sjisMaxDoubleBytesWordLength) {
452 sjisMaxDoubleBytesWordLength = sjisCurDoubleBytesWordLength;
453 }
454 }
455 else {
456 //sjisLowChars++;
457 sjisCurKatakanaWordLength = 0;
458 sjisCurDoubleBytesWordLength = 0;
459 }
460 }
461 }
462
463 if (canBeUTF8 && utf8BytesLeft > 0) {
464 canBeUTF8 = false;
465 }
466 if (canBeShiftJIS && sjisBytesLeft > 0) {
467 canBeShiftJIS = false;
468 }
469
470 // Easy -- if there is BOM or at least 1 valid not-single byte character (and no evidence it can't be UTF-8), done
471 if (canBeUTF8 && (utf8bom || utf2BytesChars + utf3BytesChars + utf4BytesChars > 0)) {
472 return CharacterSet::UTF8;
473 }
474
475 bool assumeShiftJIS = fallback == CharacterSet::Shift_JIS || fallback == CharacterSet::EUC_JP;
476 // Easy -- if assuming Shift_JIS or at least 3 valid consecutive not-ascii characters (and no evidence it can't be), done
477 if (canBeShiftJIS && (assumeShiftJIS || sjisMaxKatakanaWordLength >= 3 || sjisMaxDoubleBytesWordLength >= 3)) {
478 return CharacterSet::Shift_JIS;
479 }
480 // Distinguishing Shift_JIS and ISO-8859-1 can be a little tough for short words. The crude heuristic is:
481 // - If we saw
482 // - only two consecutive katakana chars in the whole text, or
483 // - at least 10% of bytes that could be "upper" not-alphanumeric Latin1,
484 // - then we conclude Shift_JIS, else ISO-8859-1
485 if (canBeISO88591 && canBeShiftJIS) {
486 return (sjisMaxKatakanaWordLength == 2 && sjisKatakanaChars == 2) || isoHighOther * 10 >= (int)length
487 ? CharacterSet::Shift_JIS : CharacterSet::ISO8859_1;
488 }
489
490 // Otherwise, try in order ISO-8859-1, Shift JIS, UTF-8 and fall back to default platform encoding
491 if (canBeISO88591) {
492 return CharacterSet::ISO8859_1;
493 }
494 if (canBeShiftJIS) {
495 return CharacterSet::Shift_JIS;
496 }
497 if (canBeUTF8) {
498 return CharacterSet::UTF8;
499 }
500 // Otherwise, we take a wild guess with platform encoding
501 return fallback;
502}
503
504CharacterSet
505TextDecoder::DefaultEncoding()
506{
507 return CharacterSet::ISO8859_1;
508}
509
510} // ZXing
511
